blog.name: thatwhobumblesabout
blog.title: Bumbling around
blog.description: He/him pronouns // "I'm too young to die, and too old to eat off the kids menu! What a stupid age I am!"

tags: good god i will have to blame movies with mikey for this
his video essays honestly put me on this track
summary: @all of my friends I am so sorry that so much of what I talk about is so dominated by the MCU that at this point  it borderlines...
body:
@all of my friends I am so sorry that so much of what I talk about is so dominated by the MCU that at this point it borderlines on hyperfocusing

ever since infinity war and because I am in the middle of my video essay addiction I have been tearing apart every single aspect in infinity war: the writing, individual characterizations, the villain and how they measure up to other past villains, the tone, the cinematography, the acting, the literal everything of this movie, and judging this film not just on the basis of whether it was a good film or story but also on the merits of its own existence

and in doing so I had to pull on threads that required me to go through almost every single MCU film of the past ten years and by golly gosh there is SO much good stuff that is set up and resolved in this movie and I feel like infinity war captures the essence of the comic book event in a way that only ten years of build up can and I could and plan to talk about it forever

like ten years ago who would think that in a post #tophno’s The Dark Knight superhero climate we would get Iron Man, the groundiest of grounded MCU characters, standing next to Doctor Strange in a suit made out of magical nanotech while flying in a donut to an alien planet with his son Spider-Man in tow

or from a storywriting standpoint, we are introduced to a mechanic that turns back time in another movie so that when it comes back in this one it requires no explanation and more importantly, rewinds and invalidates a story beat that is given such a good treatment that instead of taking people out of the moment we as the audience react with appropriate emotions

infinity war amazes me to no end and it makes me tentatively scared for other studios and places that try to replicate its success because infinity war was a microcosm of this new trend of cinematic universes (which is basically a mega evolved form of the film franchise) that might never be rivaled and that makes me feel sad because of course I would love for DC and Star Wars to do something to this scale but as of right now it’s looking like they can’t

and if you hate infinity war that’s fine! it’s a totally valid point to be made, it isn’t a perfect film by any stretch of the imagination, I just want people to realize that this film’s very existence should not have been possible by any means

like the force awakens, infinity war should not have been able to exist, but both of them do and more importantly, hit so many home runs in a row that it’s borderline magical

I’ll probably publish a whole essay on why Infinity War matters but that’s for another day, if you like my thoughts on this and want to hear me rant for weeks on end about this please dm me I want to talk about this forever

tags: and his voice is hoarse and he's shaking and sobbing and it's not pretty
summary: imagine everyone believing tony is dead because they cant get a hold of him no matter what they do and then several hours later...
body: imagine everyone believing tony is dead because they cant get a hold of him no matter what they do and then several hours later (after everyone regroups and whatnot) shuri picks up a signal and they zoom in on it and see tony fucking stark SCREAMING as he steers the doughnut spaceship towards earth without a care (the ship is falling to pieces thru the atmosphere) and that shit crashlands right outside wakanda and he fucking survives that shit and stumbles out of what’s left of the doughnut and straightup collapses into the first pair of arms he sees

blog.name: buhhh-no-idea-dfrfiendo
blog.title: Never Ending List of Fic Recs
blog.description: So far the main fandoms that I will be recing fics from include, in no particular order: Harry Potter, Buffy, Star Trek, Teen Wolf, Supernatural, Check Please. There will also be a smattering of Inuyasha, Sherlock Holmes, Good Omens, His Dark Materials, Doctor Who, Bones, Merlin, Star Gate, various MCU and DC fandoms, Criminal Minds, Star Wars, Avatar: Legend of Aang, Firefly, Elementary and quite a few others.

summary: Catch and Release
title: Catch and Release
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Here unfolds a tale of war, desire, and warring desires.

After the invasion of New York, Tony figures out Loki’s game, and he lays out an ultimatum that he realizes the trickster can’t escape from, maneuvering Loki into agreeing to be an ally, rather than a foe, if only when the time comes.

   A god’s sworn word is a promise that the god cannot break, but once Thanos’ head is parted from his shoulders, all bets will be off: no protections, no alliance, Loki free to do whatever he pleases, so long as he can still evade recapture at Asgard’s hands. So it’s simple, Tony tells himself: trust the war, not the god.

   It should have been simple. It was doomed to be anything but, because infatuation has no place in a war-zone, but Tony is prone to impropriety at all sorts of slightly impractical times, or he wouldn’t have wound up with the god of lies in his bed so frequently in the first place. Practicality and safe-distance plans are all going wrong, and Tony likes it too much to stop.
